data.name: title
data.value: Home

data.name: description
data.value: Home page

data.name: dear
data.value: Dear Internet users,

data.name: speech1
data.value: I am happy, in my capacity as Director of Support for the Empowerment of Women in Boumba and Ngoko (AAFEBEN), to welcome everyone to our website www.aafeben.com. You have certainly heard of AAFEBEN or read some information relating to this civil society organization created on May 11, 2001 in the district of Yokadouma, Eastern region.

data.name: speech2
data.value: It was initially set up to empower the women of this locality who were increasingly vulnerable. After several years of hard work on this issue, AAFEBEN has gradually embraced other issues on the social, environmental and economic levels. Thus placing not only women at the center but other vulnerable groups such as indigenous peoples and in general local communities for whom AAFEBEN works for their well-being.

data.name: speech3
data.value: AAFEBEN would like, thanks to the digital means of communication offered by the Internet, to be closer to its target audiences and more open to the world to better develop its notoriety both nationally and internationally. It is also an opportunity for us to meet partners who will help us achieve our mission.

data.name: speech4
data.value: Our website also allows us to promote the various products of the cooperatives in our area of ​​intervention that we support. These are non-timber forest products such as Djanssang, Tondo, black pepper, wild mango, Rondelle, Plat-plat, Mbalaka, Moabi but also cocoa... They are presented to you in all forms , starting from the first to the third transformation.

data.name: speech5
data.value: Finally, the new site will give you the opportunity to follow our daily activities. Happy browsing!!

data.name: p1
data.value: AKONGONGOL Epse MINKAM Miranda

data.name: activ
data.value: Our varied activities have a lasting impact on the individuals and communities where we operate.

data.name: activtxt
data.value: After several years of hard work, AAFEBEN has gradually embraced other social, environmental and economic issues. Our major activities have gradually increased according to the urgent needs in our intervention communities. Here are some of the most common activities:

data.name: actT1
data.value: Inclusive support for Baka and Bantu women

data.name: actP1
data.value: Empower these women through training and resources to improve their economic and social participation

data.name: actT2
data.value: Community mobilization for the fight against pandemics and epidemics

data.name: actP2
data.value: Raise awareness and educate communities to strengthen their resilience in the face of health crises.

data.name: actT3
data.value: Training and support for community businesses

data.name: actP3
data.value: Provide training and support to improve entrepreneurial skills and facilitate access to markets.

data.name: actT4
data.value: Support for reforestation of trees with high economic value

data.name: actP4
data.value: Promote the planting of trees with high economic value to restore ecosystems and generate income.

data.name: actT5
data.value: Valorization of non-wood forest products

data.name: actP5
data.value: Encourage sustainable practices to create market opportunities for products such as fruits and medicinal plants.

data.name: more
data.value: See More

data.name: p2
data.value: Director of AAFEBEN
